name: Turkish Menemen
description: Traditional Turkish breakfast of scrambled eggs with tomatoes and peppers. A staple of Turkish cuisine.

instructions.instruction: Melt butter and olive oil in a pan.
Add onions and cook for 3 minutes until translucent.
Add peppers and cook for 3 more minutes.
instructions.tip: Peppers should soften but stay slightly crisp.

instructions.instruction: Add tomatoes, season with salt and pepper.
Cook for 5-7 minutes until tomato juices reduce.
instructions.tip: Shouldn't be too dry - keep it slightly saucy.

instructions.instruction: Crack eggs and stir gently while cooking.
instructions.tip: Don't over-stir - eggs should be chunky.

instructions.instruction: Remove from heat when eggs are set. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes.

tips: Use ripe, juicy tomatoes - canned works in winter.
Don't overcook eggs - keep them moist.
Traditional sucuk (Turkish sausage) can be added.
Pairs perfectly with fresh bread or simit.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot with fresh bread and black olives.
variations: Add grated cheese on top for cheesy menemen.
Add sucuk (Turkish sausage) for a heartier version.
